answers.answer: This can be anything. Do you have family history of diabetes or heart disease? How long have you had the symptoms?  It's probably a good idea to follow up with your family doctor for a complete workup.  Unless you have been experiencing significant weight loss, hair loss, or fatigue, I would not worry too much about cancer yet.

Did they do any imaging?  i.e. CT or US?You should probably have this further investigated.........difficult to speculate what this is.Just curious.....what was the diagnosis they gave (ER)?How long have you had the symptoms?

question: I have had mild abdominal pain, nausea, back pain, dizziness, frequent urination, and radiant heat that spreads to my chest.  I went to the ER and they took blood test.  They told me my blood work was negative for pancreatitis amongst other things.  Could I still have pancreatic cancer?
title: Just Wondering, maybe a little worried.
